comments.commentBody: I worry that he may truly be unhinged.  what do we do then?
Yep, and as far as McCarthy is concerned we know how it ultimately ended for him and, to say the least, it was NOT good.
This actually lasers the focus on the Russian scandal MORE. I don't know if he meant to do that, but the fact remains.
I assume that Obama would love for Republicans to investigate this claim because it would actually lead to more information on the alleged ties between Trump and Russia.

McCarthyism: characterized chiefly by by the use of tactics involving personal attacks on individuals by means of widely publicized indiscriminate allegations especially on the basis of unsubstantiated charges; especially in order to restrict dissent or political criticism."
I think what Trump has done today is the very essence of McCarthyism.

The more the activities of Trump and friends feels like a zany circus act, or serialized comic strip, the more I find myself regarding it exactly that way. The spectacle Trump et al puts on almost daily has now become quite entertaining, and a lot less frightening. If only he didn't actually have the nuclear codes!
If we had an honest VP and congress, the 25th amendment should have been activated now.
That's quite an "if"!
Trump has no evidence - why is he just trying to pin some blame on someone to distract the country while he doesn't have any idea what he's doing?

My mother had dementia and it's sort of sneaks up on people and becomes uncomfortable when people try to pass it off as just aging, at some point the country may have to come to the realization that Donald Trump is exhibiting a little more than aging in his body, it may be his brain too.

Trump's father had Alzheimer's disease, and when you listen to Trump interviews in the 80's and his ability to be flexible in his thoughts and speech, there is a big different with the Trump today that gets bogged down with a limited vocabulary and resorts to insults, it could be signs of early onset Alzheimer's, after all it does run in the family.
Just reading on the subject of memory that if a lie is told enough times, it will be believed by many (from the book Where Did I Leave My Glasses) . Scary stuff about the brain's inner workings.

Trump continues to use "alternative facts" to mislead and combat findings of legitimate government and journalists' investigations, even when our national security is at stake.  It's reckless and dangerous.

Dr. Alvarado, you are straining very hard to discredit calls for an independent investigation on the grounds that the details of unexplained favoritism to Russia's aggressive behavior in Europe and its clear interference with an American election -- coupled with lies about private contact with Russian officials during the campaign -- cannot be known without an independent investigation. The most charitable thing which can be said about your comment is that it is remarkable circular.
Now, what did President Trump say in his speech the other night, wasn't it something  about stopping the petty fights?

His claims are insane but they are being believed. Look at some of the comments around the internet and read the rightwing press -- Fox News is gleefully reporting this as if it is real, and so are the rightwing press (the news providers that the so many low information voters read) like Brietbart, infowars, the Washington Times, etc., are reporting this as if true. We are doomed.
The sacrifice of the United States government as a constitutional democracy is a small price for US citizens to pay to insure the continuing success of Trump Inc.
If anyone had any doubts about the need for an independent, nonpartisan special investigator, Trump's gross overreaction makes it seem all the more plausible that there really is something to hide.

Let's see how well the stock market does on Monday. I can't imagine consumer and business confidence will remain high for long with a seriously unstable president in office or the potential for his removal
Can we revisit that discussion about Trump's mental illness?

If there is any strategy to Trump's ridiculous accusation, the only one it might be is that he thinks if he can draw Obama out into open conflict with him, then he can get his followers all riled up to high level of "hate Obama" feelings they had before the election. Obama is far too smart to get down on Trump's extremely base level.

If this was really Trump's "maiden speech to Congress," I suppose we should all be thankful that he didn't boast about his disposition towards kitty-grabbing. Instead he gets credit for behaving himself in much the same manner as a serial burglar who gets out of jail before his sentence is up because he didn't break into any homes during his period of incarceration.

Trumpy the Swamp Thing said, “just found out," which is Trumptalk for "I heard about it on an alt-right news source."

The wild swings in his mood and irrational unfounded assertions make me think there is something to claims that he is unhinged. I suppose spending so much time in swamp water can do that to an already addled brain.

He is going to implode, and when he does I hope he doesn't take the rest of us with him. Maybe just the entire Republican congressional delegation. That would be fine.

Remember that Benghazi thing? Four State Dept. employees were killed when they were attacked by a large band of rogue terrorists. The Republicans practically accused Hillary Clinton of murder because she personally didn't see to it that they were provided sufficient security in case they were attacked by a formidable force. Trump wants to cut funding for the State by 37%. That ought to keep our people safe.

Trump has been trashing NATO for two years now. He utters one sentence and we are supposed to believe that he has changed? Then he contradicts himself in the same speech. Why even raise the possibility of maintaining support. Ask Bannon. He will give you the answer.

Border taxes are a catastrophe. Pick up a catalog from an electronics supplier like Mouser and go through the 2000+ pages. Tabulate how many parts are made in the US. Good luck finding that needle.

Trees are cut down in Canada, shipped to China and come back as plywood. Go see how many plumbing fittings are made here. How many hand and power tools? Check out how many sheet metal suppliers use imported stock. The amount and scope of imported materials is so vast that no industry does without them.

Immigrant workers? Talk to the contractors. They will tell you how hard it is to find US born workers. Without the trade unions, the supply of skilled tradesmen has been cutoff. Talk to the hotels. See who shows up to clean the rooms.

Trump is trying to fool us has Bannon has fooled him.
Really easy to fool a fool.  Just saying.

Actually the Ambassador was ordered to leave several times but he said the people wouldn't hurt him because they loved him. Then they were not even in an embassy they were in a CIA outpost. And the two ex-Seals were trained killer's working for the CIA. Once you have signed your name on the line when you join the military you know the potential that you could die. Then they became Seals and that even raised their potential even more that they would die. They then left the Seals and went to work for the CIA as trained Killers which even raised their potential to die to another level.  When I was stationed in Okinawa during the Cold War I spoke to the US Ambassador from China  . I asked him how they handled the danger of being in these countries. He said they knew at anytime their lives could be in danger and it could be deadly. They still went to these countries knowing this information. I feel bad they died but they died doing what they loved. SMsgt USAF Ret.

I can not wait for another embassy invasion to occur on Putins puppets term in office.
Then the GOP will have some 'splain' to do to Americans and especially to those who lost family members because the GOP cut funding to the state dept.
They will never own up to it, and they won't have 9 investigations aka hearings on what really happened because they will find a way to blame it on Obama, or Clinton or some 400 pound man sitting on his bed.

trump can eat Rocky Mountain Oysters for all I care. Some people criticize others for all manner of things, like wearing sparkly outfits or wearing sleeveless outfits or golfing too much or taking too many vacations or not having the "correct" birth certificate.

They do it to make themselves feel better or to get attention. The freedom of the press and the freedom of speech is what makes those criticisms possible. I'm all for the freedoms etched in our constitution.

Just please, don't make these petty criticisms the center of attention. There are more important things to focus on right now.
Rocky Mountain oysters are meant to be deep fried and served with, um, sauces. A good steak?  Not so much

Here's what's so baffling yet so telling. Trump protests this delusional wiretapping by saying it's like "Watergate." Is this ignorance or an admission of guilt? Does he realize that those recordings are what helped expose the person who ordered Watergate? Is he basically telling the world that he's guilty as Nixon?

When Trumpet thought he was going to lose the election, in the final days of the race, he began to lambaste the press, say that voting was rigged.  I believe if he had lost it was his desire to start a conflagration with his supporters as the accellerant. As his administration's Russian connections and subsequent coverup threaten to evolve from the drip, drip of damning information to a cataract of possibly illegal actions he appears to be doing the same. Trump is in trouble and US democracy better watch out.
